title: Heating cables
fullText:
Heating cables shall be so installed that they are not in contact with flammable materials and where designed to be embeddedâ€”
(a) are completely and adequately embedded in the substance they are intended to heat; and
(b) do not suffer any detrimental effect because of flexing or movement of the substance in which they are embedded.
Alternatively, where designed as trace heating cables, heating cables shall provide adequate heat transfer to the surface or material to which they are fixed.
In New Zealand only, in-floor and ceiling heating cables shall be installed in accordance with NZS 6110.
